titleStmt.title: James W. Cunningham et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9911

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: Whereas George W Donley Stands Adjudged before the Magistrates Court of Athens Fayette County) (S. S Grimes Presiding Justice) for the Sum of fiteen dollars and Cost being the amount of a fine imposed against Said Donelly in October last before the said Court for a Breach of the Peace as above, and we the undersigned Petitioners to your Excelency having known the Said Donley for the last ten years and have never known him to be arrainged for any offense against the Commonwealth, we your Petitioners thefore under the above Concideration pray that you Exercise your remiting Power in his Case

Names
James. W. Cunningham C. F. C ^Plaintiff^
William Hayes Jr
F M Awbrey
Wm Faulroner
